intro: Onobroma lucidum, commonly known as the shining trumpet flower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is also noted for its ability to produce a milky latex when the stems or leaves are damaged.
